definitions.text: an impetuous rush toward someone or something
examples: the wrestler's charge carried him past his adversary
the battle began with a cavalry charge

definitions.text: (criminal law) a pleading describing some wrong or offense
examples: he was arrested on a charge of larceny

definitions.text: the price charged for some article or service
examples: the admission charge

definitions.text: the quantity of unbalanced electricity in a body (either positive or negative) and construed as an excess or deficiency of electrons
examples: the battery needed a fresh charge

definitions.text: attention and management implying responsibility for safety
examples: he is in the care of a bodyguard

definitions.text: a special assignment that is given to a person or group
examples: a confidential mission to London
his charge was deliver a message

definitions.text: a person committed to your care
examples: the teacher led her charges across the street

definitions.text: financial liabilities (such as a tax)
examples: the charges against the estate

definitions.text: (psychoanalysis) the libidinal energy invested in some idea or person or object
examples: Freud thought of cathexis as a psychic analog of an electrical charge

definitions.text: the swift release of a store of affective force
examples: they got a great bang out of it
what a boot!
he got a quick rush from injecting heroin
he does it for kicks

definitions.text: request for payment of a debt
examples: they submitted their charges at the end of each month

definitions.text: a formal statement of a command or injunction to do something
examples: the judge's charge to the jury

definitions.text: an assertion that someone is guilty of a fault or offence
examples: the newspaper published charges that Jones was guilty of drunken driving

definitions.text: heraldry consisting of a design or image depicted on a shield
a quantity of explosive to be set off at one time
examples: this cartridge has a powder charge of 50 grains

definitions.text: to make a rush at or sudden attack upon, as in battle
examples: he saw Jess charging at him with a pitchfork

definitions.text: blame for, make a claim of wrongdoing or misbehavior against
examples: he charged the director with indifference

definitions.text: demand payment
examples: Will I get charged for this service?
We were billed for 4 nights in the hotel, although we stayed only 3 nights

definitions.text: move quickly and violently
examples: The car tore down the street
He came charging into my office

definitions.text: assign a duty, responsibility or obligation to
examples: He was appointed deputy manager
She was charged with supervising the creation of a concordance

definitions.text: file a formal charge against
examples: The suspect was charged with murdering his wife

definitions.text: make an accusatory claim
examples: The defense attorney charged that the jurors were biased

definitions.text: fill or load to capacity
examples: charge the wagon with hay

definitions.text: enter a certain amount as a charge
examples: he charged me $15

definitions.text: cause to be admitted; of persons to an institution
examples: After the second episode, she had to be committed
he was committed to prison

definitions.text: give over to another for care or safekeeping
examples: consign your baggage

definitions.text: pay with a credit card; pay with plastic money; postpone payment by recording a purchase as a debt
examples: Will you pay cash or charge the purchase?

definitions.text: lie down on command, of hunting dogs
cause to be agitated, excited, or roused
examples: The speaker charged up the crowd with his inflammatory remarks

definitions.text: place a heraldic bearing on
examples: charge all weapons, shields, and banners

definitions.text: provide (a device) with something necessary
examples: He loaded his gun carefully
load the camera

definitions.text: direct into a position for use
examples: point a gun
He charged his weapon at me

definitions.text: impose a task upon, assign a responsibility to
examples: He charged her with cleaning up all the files over the weekend

definitions.text: instruct (a jury) about the law, its application, and the weighing of evidence
instruct or command with authority
examples: The teacher charged the children to memorize the poem

definitions.text: attribute responsibility to
examples: We blamed the accident on her
The tragedy was charged to her inexperience

definitions.text: set or ask for a certain price
examples: How much do you charge for lunch?
This fellow charges $100 for a massage

definitions.text: cause formation of a net electrical charge in or on
examples: charge a conductor

definitions.text: energize a battery by passing a current through it in the direction opposite to discharge
examples: I need to charge my car battery

definitions.text: saturate
examples: The room was charged with tension and anxiety
